definitions.definition: The dry , leafy or stringy exterior of certain vegetables or fruits , which must be removed before eating the meat inside.
examples: A coconut has a very thick husk .

definitions.definition: ( figuratively ) Any form of useless , dried up , and subsequently worthless exterior of something.
examples: His attorney was a dried-up husk of a man.

definitions.definition: The supporting frame of a run of millstones .

main_definition: The dry , leafy or stringy exterior of certain vegetables or fruits , which must be removed before eating the meat inside.
secondary_definitions: ( figuratively ) Any form of useless , dried up , and subsequently worthless exterior of something.
The supporting frame of a run of millstones .

definitions.definition: An infection in cattle caused by a species of Dictyocaulus or lungworm

main_definition: An infection in cattle caused by a species of Dictyocaulus or lungworm
